question:
The IMD recently predicted that Indiaâ€™s core cold wave regions would become warmer. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Rajasthan is a part of this cold wave zone.
  2. Telangana is a part of the zone.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Indian Meteorological department recently predicted that the 2019 winter will be warmer in the core cold wave zone of India. Rajasthan is a part of this zone. Other states adjoin it like Punjab, Haryana, Gujarat and Maharashtra are also within this zone. Statement 2 is correct: Telangana is one of the states in the cold wave zone. It is the only south India state. Union territories like J&K and Ladakh are also expected to experience this condition. The experts have pinned the global warming as the reason. Warm waters in the equatorial Pacific Ocean is also a contributing factor.
